SIZED A curatorial practice devoted to creating exhibitions and installations that bring art and design into dialogue with architecture. Working nomadically, it identifies distinctive
spaces, whether historic, industrial, or modernist, and reimagines them as temporary settings for the display of objects. Each project is guided by a precise attention to
placement, proportion, and atmosphere, allowing works to be encountered with clarity and resonance.
Its work spans disciplines, from contemporary art and collectible design to collaborations with galleries, institutions, and brands. What defines SIZED is a commitment to
context. Every space is considered not as a backdrop but as an active element that shapes perception and meaning. This approach has produced environments that invite
reflection and deepen the encounter between object and audience.

Through these projects, SIZED has developed a body of exhibitions and activations that explore how objects can be understood beyond function or form, as carriers of
history, authorship, and presence. In doing so, it continues to contribute to the evolving language of collecting and exhibition-making, creating temporary worlds in which
art and design acquire renewed significance.
